text: This isn't the first time that I've really enjoyed jazz from video games and then tried to find similar stuff from "actual" jazz unsuccessfully.
author: Albatrosspro

text: I know this is an old comment, but check out Pat Metheny, Acoustic Alchemy, and Spyro Gyra. The first two have MASSIVE discographies though, so you may need to dig. Older stuff is usually better, IMO. Check out Metheny's "Secret Story" album for starters, but his stuff is so diverse. This music also reminds me of some Funki Poricini.

author: Clavier Fumant

text: Is Wild arms a game I should check out? It has shown up on this channel multiple times.
author: lucas smith

text:
'course you should! Just don't have too high standards when it comes to graphics, as even the fifth installment of the series is seriously outdated on that level (and the first one is just plain horrible with non-mapped 3D), but the games are part of a seriously underrated series of japanese role playing game.

I've played four of the five regular installments (there were one or two spinoffs, not released in Europe), the first, the third, the fourth (my favorite) and the fifth.

And they're goddamn fabulous games with often a really good soundtrack. Too bad it seems the series died alongside the PS2...
author: Bal Sagoth

text: Bal Sagoth I know this is late as hell, but it's so good to finally find someone else who likes this series. The 4th one has been my favourite game ever since I first played it when it came out so many years ago. C:
